articles.headline: Anti-U.S. Cleric Returns to Iraq, and to Power
articles.snippet: Moktada al-Sadr, whose followers waged deadly warfare against American troops, returned to Iraq after three years in Iran.
articles.abstract: Moktada al-Sadr, whose followers waged deadly warfare against American troops, returned to Iraq after three years in Iran.
articles.lead_paragraph: BAGHDAD  Moktada al-Sadr, the populist cleric who emerged as the United States’ most enduring foe in Iraq, returned Wednesday after more than three years of voluntary exile in Iran in a homecoming that embodied his and his movement’s transition from battling in the streets to occupying the halls of power.
articles.byline: By Anthony Shadid and John Leland

articles.headline: Taking Control, G.O.P. Overhauls Rules in House
articles.snippet: The newly elected House Speaker John Boehner on Wednesday promised a new era of transparency while vowing to push forward the conservative agenda that swept his party into power.
articles.abstract: The newly elected House Speaker John Boehner on Wednesday promised a new era of transparency while vowing to push forward the conservative agenda that swept his party into power.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Jubilant Republicans took control of the House on Wednesday and installed Representative John A. Boehner of Ohio as the new speaker before pushing through an overhaul of House rules intended to expedite their drive to dismantle the new health care law, cut federal spending and provide the tax cuts they see as a way to jump-start the economy.

articles.headline: Pentagon Is Poised to Cancel Marine Landing Craft
articles.snippet: The $14.4 billion program has been hurt by delays and cost overruns, and a view that amphibious assaults have grown less effective.
articles.abstract: The $14.4 billion program has been hurt by delays and cost overruns, and a view that amphibious assaults have grown less effective.
articles.lead_paragraph: It was supposed to be a tank that swims, a new way for the Marines to storm hostile beaches.

articles.headline: A Bonanza in TV Sales Fades Away
articles.snippet: Most people who wanted a flat-screen TV have one, and 3-D and Internet connections are not catching on with consumers.
articles.abstract: Most people who wanted a flat-screen TV have one, and 3-D and Internet connections are not catching on with consumers.
articles.lead_paragraph: LAS VEGAS  By now, most Americans have taken the leap and tossed out their old boxy televisions in favor of sleek flat-panel displays.

articles.headline: Obama Turning to Experienced Hands as He Remakes Staff
articles.snippet: President Obama is closing in on a decision to fill two top positions and recharge his administration in a time of divided government.
articles.abstract: President Obama is closing in on a decision to fill two top positions and recharge his administration in a time of divided government.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  President Obama closed in Wednesday on a decision to fill two top positions and recharge his administration, stopping just short of naming a new chief of staff and a top economic adviser to guide the White House through a new period of divided government.
articles.byline: By Jeff Zeleny and Jackie Calmes
